fields.value: Census of Public and Private Juvenile Detention, Correctional, and Shelter Facilities, 1992-1993: [United States]

authorName.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention

dsDescriptionValue.value: These data provide information on the population and characteristics of public and private juvenile facilities in operation in the United States on February 16, 1993. Annual data for the 1992 calendar year are included as well. Questions designed to categorize each facility were asked of facility administrators concerning the number of adults held, the juvenile majority's custodial authority, reason for custody, and access to the community, as well as the facility's security arrangements, capacity, age, plans for renovation, type of administration, and setting. Extensive data on the total juvenile residential population of each facility were also gathered. The total population is broken down by admission type, legal status, type of offense, race, and age. The collection also contains information on the population's movement and average length of stay, as well as each facility's average daily population, personnel by race, number, and staff position, educational, treatment, and medical programs available, annual expenditures, court orders and consent decrees, and number of juvenile deaths that year.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System

seriesName.value: Census of Public and Private Juvenile Detention, Correctional, and Shelter Facilities Series

value: Public and private juvenile detention, correctional, and shelter facilities in operation in the United States on February 16, 1993.

fields.value:
Residential programs and group homes in operation on  February 16
, 1993, were included in the census if they housed three or  more residents, if at least 50 percent of the residents were  juveniles, and if accused or adjudicated delinquents and status  offenders constituted at least 1 percent of their average daily  population. In California, however, all California Youth Authority  Facilities were included in the census. Juvenile facilities operated  as part of adult jails were excluded, as were nonresidential  facilities, facilities exclusively for drug or alcohol abusers or nonoffenders, and federal juvenile correctional facilities.
